ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: The mode of learning was meeting over zoom. This included discussions of our writing and peer editing through screen sharing.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I gained better Polish writing skills. A good portion of the class was focused on improving writing. I also learned to read better, gained a larger vocabulary, and learned many new insights into the Polish culture.

This course deepened my understanding of the Polish language as well as giving me more insight into the contributions of famous Polish migrants who lived in the US. This allowed me to improve my reading in Polish because of the many readings given during the course. My conversational Polish skills also increased because of the complete immersion in the language during class. Finally, my grammar skills also improved because of the homework assignments.
I developed my Polish speaking, reading and listening comprehension. I also learned about Polish and American history by reading complex and compelling texts in Polish.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The strengths of the course were that it allowed room for the students to incorporate their own interests. This made the course much more engaging and interesting. It was also strong in that it focused on many different aspects of the Polish language and culture. A weakness was that some topics were covered in too much detail, taking away from other topics that were also supposed to be covered. The course could be improved by better balancing out time among the different topics.

The strengths mainly come from the small class size as well as the full emersion in the language, as this allowed for great whole class discussions where everyone could participate easily. There were not many weaknesses but I would say that sometimes, there was too much time spent on correcting homework which led to some less eventful days in class.
This was a wonderful course that elevated my Polish skill levels. The virtual format, in which students presented on the texts we read and then discussed the main ideas, surpassed my expectations.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Screen sharing was used in order to display each of the students writing. Additionally, screen sharing was used to share various articles on current events in Poland or cultural aspects. Given the circumstances, I think that this was adequate and I don't see how it could be improved further.
I think that even with the pandemic, the course still went flawlessly and adapted very well to the virtual format.

Successes: using virtual screenshare as a way to read texts. It was easy to follow along with dense texts sentence by sentence. 

Weaknesses: None besides not being able to interact and converse in person

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend this course to others trying to refine their skills in polish. The course combined multiple different types of assignments in order to get a deeper understanding of the Polish language. The combination of writing assignments, group editing sessions,  writing corrections, discussion time, readings, and cultural lectures created a rounded course that involved many different elements of the language and culture.

I would definitely recommend this class to anybody who has familiarity in the polish language that would also like to greatly enhance their understanding of Polish-Americans who had an impact on society.
Absolutetly. Anyone interested in learning Polish should take this class.
